title: Which do you use spelled or spelt? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which do you use spelled or spelt? As a British person, I use both - which I use depends on my mood at the time and how it lies with the rest of what I am writing. The same with ‘learned’ and ‘learnt’, and ‘burned’ and ‘burnt’. The fact is that all of these forms are perfectly correct on both sides of the Atlantic with no difference in meaning. The suggestion in one answer that it has to do with whether it is used transitively or intransitively or in passive contexts is utter gibberish. Sometimes, if I am feeling mischievous I deliberately use “spelt” knowing that someone will come back to me with some supposedly clever quip about “spelt” being a type of grass - thus giving me an opportunity to reply and point out how ignorant they are …..

These days I used spelled, if for no other reason that spelt is some sort of a grain. I like words to be clear. It was spelt differently. Does that mean a different type of spelt the grain? It was spelled differently. OK, I use the Irish spelling and he the British spelling (amn’t vs. aren’t: Aren’t I tired? vs. Amn’t I tired?) I like to know whether we are discussing agriculture or English.
